title: street sign
content:
I have to match this face as closely as possible, but it looks hand-stenciled. Suggestions?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [champs\_elysees.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080507181010/http:/typophile.com/files/champs_elysees.jpg) | 28.69 KB |

 [‹ need help with another font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080507181010/http:/typophile.com/node/45049 "Go to previous forum topic") [squaresoft/square co logo font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080507181010/http:/typophile.com/node/44987 "Go to next forum topic")
author: The Don Killuminati

comments.content: [Trade Gothic No. 2 Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080507181010/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/trade_gothic_no_2_bold/?sample_text=CHAMPS%20%C3%89LYS%C3%89ES) might be your best bet.

Wow. It’s not exact, but that is really, really close.  
Thank you so much, M. Cole.

M. stands for monsieur, monsieur.

- Lex

<cite>and I suppose “Cole” stands for “Coles” :-P</cite>

It looks very much like the official traffic sign font from France, Caractères L2. See page 49 of [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080507181010/http:/portail.documentation.equipement.gouv.fr/documents/Dtrf/0002/Dtrf-0002703/TO2703.pdf).

And indeed it is. Thank you for that. Particularly nice how the center of the M comes down to a narrow point. And the first item up when googled is a free version by Frank Rausch. We’ll give it a shot.  
Thanks again.
